title: BACKTESTING CRT DAY GOOD AND BAD CONFIRMATION
description: Identifying good vs bad confirmations in backtesting and filtering setups.
content:
In this lesson, you'll learn:

• Proper backtesting methodology
• Good confirmation characteristics
• Bad confirmation warning signs
• Liquidity sweep + structure shift importance
• Filtering low-quality setups
• Improving system probability

quiz.question: A valid backtest must include:
quiz.explanation: Valid backtesting follows defined rules consistently without emotions or exceptions.

quiz.question: Good confirmation in CRT typically includes:
quiz.explanation: Best confirmations show liquidity grab followed by structural break.

quiz.question: Bad confirmation often shows:
quiz.explanation: Weak confirmations lack follow-through momentum after the setup forms.

quiz.question: Backtesting primarily measures:
quiz.explanation: Backtesting reveals the historical win rate and edge of your trading system.

quiz.question: The purpose of identifying bad confirmations is to:
quiz.explanation: Identifying bad signals allows you to skip low-probability trades and improve overall returns.
